intro: Callipsyche auratum, commonly known as the golden hooktail, is a species of caddisfly belonging to the family Limnophoridae. It is characterized by its elongated, slender body and distinctive golden coloration on its abdomen. The larvae of this species are aquatic and construct cases made of fine sand and small particles. They are typically found in slow-moving freshwater environments such as ponds and streams. The adult stage is short-lived, with the primary purpose of reproduction.
